title: BUG: shap.plots.heatmap() can't handle Explanation without feature_names

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behaviour

labels.name: awaiting feedback
labels.description: Indicates that further information is required from the issue creator

body:
### Issue Description

In `shap.plots.beeswarm()`, if the input `Explanation` does not have specified `feature_names`, default names are created which I believe it's done here:
https://github.com/shap/shap/blob/ec17a2604127c16b83caaf8e3b4d10eeadaa73ee/shap/plots/_beeswarm.py#L155

But `shap.plots.beeswarm()` does not. This causes an error at the line below, if the input `Explanation` doesn't have `feature_names` specified (it is `None`):
https://github.com/shap/shap/blob/ec17a2604127c16b83caaf8e3b4d10eeadaa73ee/shap/plots/_heatmap.py#L81


### Minimal Reproducible Example

```python
I do not have a minimal reproducible example (also I believe the nature of the problem is clear enough).
```


### Traceback

```shell
IndexError                                Traceback (most recent call last)
Cell In[1], line 2
      1 exp = shap.Explanation(shap_values, base_values, data)
----> 2 shap.plots.heatmap(exp)

File ~/.conda/envs/env_name/lib/python3.11/site-packages/shap/plots/_heatmap.py:81, in heatmap(shap_values, instance_order, feature_values, feature_order, max_display, cmap, show, plot_width)
     72 instance_order = convert_ordering(instance_order, shap_values)
     73 # if issubclass(type(instance_order), OpChain):
     74 #     #xlabel += " " + instance_order.summary_string("SHAP values")
     75 #     instance_order = instance_order.apply(Explanation(values))
   (...)
     78 # else:
     79 #     instance_order_ops = None
---> 81 feature_names = np.array(shap_values.feature_names)[feature_order]
     82 values = shap_values.values[instance_order][:,feature_order]
     83 feature_values = feature_values[feature_order]

IndexError: too many indices for array: array is 0-dimensional, but 1 were indexed
```


### Expected Behavior

There should be code in `shap.plots.heatmap()` similar to that in `shap.plots.beeswarm()` mentioned above for example which creates default feature names when `feature_names` is `None` in the `Explanation`.

### Bug report checklist

- [X] I have checked that this issue has not already been reported.
- [X] I have confirmed this bug exists on the [latest release](https://github.com/shap/shap/releases) of shap.
- [X] I have confirmed this bug exists on the [master branch](https://github.com/shap/shap/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#installing-from-the-master-branch) of shap.
- [ ] I'd be interested in making a PR to fix this bug

### Installed Versions

0.42.1
